properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. A moist Pacific frontal system will continue to bring heavy rain to the south coast tonight. West Vancouver Island will receive the heaviest amount with 90 to 120 mm expected by Saturday morning. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-10T14:40:21-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-09T22:41:21-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1159800550.2020
Area: West Vancouver Island
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Possible accumulating snow over higher terrain today and tonight. Location: west coast of Newfoundland. Time span: continuing through overnight tonight. Remarks: Rain, occasionally mixed with snow, will taper off tonight to showers or flurries. While rain is generally expected along the coast, snow inland and over higher terrain will accumulate between 5 and 10 cm of snow by Saturday morning. Rain is again expected on Saturday night associated with another system moving in from the west. However, it seems less likely that it will be significant enough to cause any warnings. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-10-10T10:22:04-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-09T18:23:04-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3201769888.2020
Area: Corner Brook and vicinity, Gros Morne, Bay St. George, Parson's Pond - Hawke's Bay, Port Saunders and the Straits
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Maximum gusts: northwesterly 80 km/h, except 100 along parts of the coast. Locations: northern Labrador. Time span: tonight through to Saturday morning. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-10-10T13:59:17-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-10T01:37:17-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0502623907.2020
Area: Postville - Makkovik, Hopedale and vicinity, Nain and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. A moist Pacific frontal system will continue to bring heavy rain to the south coast tonight. Higher rainfall amounts are expected over Howe Sound and northern sections of Metro Vancouver where 50 to 70 mm of rain are expected by Saturday morning. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-10T14:39:51-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-09T22:40:51-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1480500878.2020
Area: Howe Sound, Metro Vancouver - North Shore including West Vancouver and North Vancouver, Metro Vancouver - northeast including Coquitlam and Maple Ridge
properties.Author: Environment Canada
